focused on delivering unsurpassed services in support of law enforcement and homeland security, fsa, a rapidly growing joint venture owned by trusted solutions providers saic and aecom, has a vacancy for a data analyst supporting health care fraud unit of the fbi.

join the health care fraud unit and be part of a dynamic team that not only supports the fbi headquarters, but also provides opportunities for the team to participate in "temporary duty assignments (tdy) supporting the fbi field offices. this unique opportunity allows employees to interact with colleagues in various locations, while also providing an opportunity to develop new skills as you grow your career with one of the most prestigious organizations in the law enforcement community.

the day to day environment consists of meaningful work at a steady pace while ensuring quality work products are produced without the added pressures of hard deadlines. employees are encouraged to participate in teambuilding/bonding activities to include office celebrations, birthdays, anniversaries, milestones, awards and yes, even an occasional happy hour.

additional office related benefits include:

flexible work schedules;
overtime;
short-term tdy travel; and
variety of special projects

a data analyst executes the following duties:

provide organization and management of case files

9.title: Operations Analyst
9.posting:
operations analyst
job #: req3615

organization: world bank

sector: operations

grade: ge

term duration: 3 years 0 months

recruitment type: local recruitment

location: washington, dc

required language(s): english

preferred language(s):

closing date: 7/19/2019 (mm/dd/yyyy) at 11:59pm utc


description

established in 1944, the wbg is one of the world’s largest sources of funding and knowledge for development solutions. in fiscal year 2018, the wbg committed $67 billion in loans, grants, equity investments and guarantees to its members and private businesses, of which $24 billion was concessional finance to its poorest members. it is governed by 188-member countries and delivers services out of 120 offices with nearly 15,000 staff located globally.

the wbg consists of five specialized institutions: the international bank for reconstruction and development (ibrd), the international development association (ida), the international finance corporation (ifc), the multilateral investment guarantee agency (miga), and the international centre for the settlement of investment disputes (icsid). the world bank is organized into six client-facing regional vice-presidencies, several corporate functions and thirteen global practices to bring best-in-class knowledge and solutions to regional and country clients.

vpu context

operations policy and country services (opcs) plays a pivotal role in achieving the wbg’s mission. opcs is at the center of operations and delivery and serves as the back office for operations for the wb’s ceo. the vpu helps foster links between the global practices and the regions, while assisting frontline staff in delivering results to clients through sound operations policy and strong country support. opcs develops and oversees the wb’s operational policies for country strategies, lending operations, advisory services and analytical support, financial management, procurement, and environmental and social safeguards. this includes advising and providing hands-on assistance on the wb’s policies, processes, and risk management related to operations (e.g. use of financing instruments; on procurement, financial management, and safeguards matters; and on results management). opcs is also responsible for modernizing operational instruments (lending and non-lending) to help the wb become more responsive to country needs. several corporate functions carried out by opcs include coordinating exchanges with the board (in particular, the committee on development effectiveness), managing interactions with the wb’s oversight units, and representing the wb in several global partnerships.

opcs is organized into the front office and three departments:
operations standards, procurement, financial management (opspf) is responsible for safeguards, procurement, financial management and anti-corruption policies and support to operations
operations policy (opspo) consolidates the corporate support and oversight of country strategies and all financing and advisory instruments as well as managing the operations committee and the operations help desk
operations strategy, risk, and results (opsrr) focuses on wb strategy; risk management in operations, strengthening results and effectiveness throughout the institution, including the corporate scorecard; support to the country directors’ and management communities; and operational learning
the front office (opsfo) focuses on supporting the opcs vice president (vp) in the management of the operations complex and the delivery of key corporate policy commitments and reforms. opsfo includes the operations management (om) team
unit context
opsfo has overall responsibility for providing support to the opcs vice president on the delivery of the opcs work program, and for ensuring an effective and efficient workflow within opcs, with the ceo’s office, the corporate secretariat, and other wb units. the work of the operations management (om) team within opsfo can be broadly divided into four areas:
operations management
help manage and analyze wb operational portfolio and pipeline
prepare the wb operations weekly update to the ceo
provide quarterly operational analysis, reporting and support to the operations council and the matrix vice presidents’ (mvp) meetings
support front line staff by coordinating and managing the pipeline and board scheduling
lead corporate lending and disbursement projections exercise
corporate reporting
analyze operations and support effective wb portfolio management and decision making through the wb operations update to the board and the quarterly business and risk review (qbrr)
assist in the monitoring of ida18 implementation and ida19 replenishment (including policy commitments and management seminars) and the ibrd capital package commitments
conduct data analysis for and support preparation of regional and pg update
provide data analysis and validation for the corporate scorecard, financial statements and md&a, wbg annual report, and flash report
analytics and research
conduct pipeline and portfolio analysis to enrich discussions on operational issues including financing, corporate commitments, quality indicators, disbursement metrics, risk in operations, and bunching metrics
develop and upgrade the project disbursement projection tool as an integral part of the operations portal, helping task teams to more accurately project disbursements over the lifetime of ipf projects
partner with teams across the bank to analyze and interpret key data related to corporate priorities including climate co-benefits, gender, agile, and maximizing finance for development
systems and data
use text mining and machine learning techniques to automate sector and theme coding process
lead the annual portfolio data system clean-up exercise
serve as secretariat to the corporate data governance council
partner with its on the development and governance of important corporate data sharing initiatives such as standard reports, text analytics and ida tracking
serve as the secretariat for the corporate data council
opsfo is led by the front office (fo) manager who is part of the opcs leadership team. the operations analyst will report to the fo manager, and will be called upon to contribute towards different unit activities, carrying out his/her tasks in close collaboration with other team members, as required.
duties and accountabilities
conduct in-depth statistical analysis of operations data, contributing to the development of new metrics and updating existing indicators as new operational instruments and procedures are introduced
monitor and regularly validate data in the bank’s operations systems; provide policy and procedural guidance to teams to ensure data quality
produce reporting deliverables to help monitor the financing program and portfolio, including presentations for operations council and mvp meetings, operations updates to the board, wb operations weekly update to the ceo, annual report, and others as requested
contribute to talking points and briefing notes for management in preparation of high-level discussions on operations management
liaise with the development finance (dfi) team to monitor the usage of ida allocations and provide data analysis on ida portfolio quality and performance for ida papers
collaborate with regions, global practices, and corporate units and coordinate their contribution to corporate reporting tasks, particularly on ibrd and ida pipeline and portfolio analysis
partner with its, wfa, dfi, and other teams on identifying improvements to bank systems that are relevant to corporate reporting and operational data
contribute to special research projects on the operations portfolio and pipeline and summarize the findings into final products such as technical briefings and presentations
support the wbg-wide initiative to enhance corporate data governance
assist in coordinating with regions and secpo to have operations scheduled for the board
selection criteria

master’s in a relevant discipline (e.g. economics, finance, business administration, social sciences, or other field related to development) and at least two years of relevant professional experience
familiarity with world bank operations preferably through experience in a region or global practice
full proficiency and hands-on experience with analyzing large datasets, ability to work quickly in excel, particularly with creating data models and visuals using more advanced concepts (powerquery, powerpivot, powerbi)
expert user of ms excel and powerpoint, experience with tableau or stata desirable
good familiarity and ease of working with the bank’s data systems and tools including standard reports, sap, analysis for office (ao), business intelligence and the portal
keen attention to detail, uncompromising on quality. double-checks own work and work of others for accuracy and consistency
good oral and written communication skills; the ability to translate technical content into plain language; capacity to prepare reports and presentations using word and powerpoint
familiarity with world bank products and services and project cycle
demonstrated client orientation with the ability to respond effectively to internal and external client requests, and set priorities for self and others
strong interpersonal skills, collaborating and working across boundaries
high degree of innovation, initiative, flexibility, reliability and responsiveness
proven ability to handle multiple tasks independently, work under pressure with short deadlines, and be a problem solver
high levels of energy, attention to detail and flexibility in adjusting to changing work program requirements in a dynamic and fast paced work environment
general competencies
in addition to the above, the successful candidate must demonstrate the following competencies:
excellent communications skills - both in oral presentations and in writing sections of papers, briefs, independent reports, including the ability to speak and write persuasively and present ideas clearly, concisely and accurately
capacity to multi-task - work simultaneously on a variety of issues and tasks, independently adjusting to priorities and achieving results with agreed objectives and deadlines
strong interpersonal skills - ability to work effectively with internal/external partners and promote collaboration in a multi-cultural environment
project management - understand the basic concepts of project management, as they relate to the execution of tasks within a project
data collection and management - demonstrate the ability to collect, curate and process data in order to use for analysis and decision making
bank instruments, policies, procedures, and systems - basic knowledge of bank instruments, policies and procedures, including safeguards, fm and procurement
portfolio management - assists and/or organizes portfolio reviews; prepares portfolio monitoring reports, and follows-up on portfolio review recommendations
analytical and technical skills, operational strategy development & advice - solid theoretical base with relevance for specific bank network recognized sector or theme
core competencies
lead and innovate - brings new and different insights
deliver results for clients - contributes to delivery of results for clients on complex issues
collaborate within teams and across boundaries - collaborates within team and across boundaries
create, apply and share knowledge - actively contributes to and readily applies wbg’s body of knowledge for internal and/or external client solutions
make smart decisions - leverages available data and makes timely decisions
the world bank group values diversity and encourages all qualified candidates who are nationals of world bank group member countries to apply, regardless of gender, gender identity, religion, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or disability. sub-saharan african nationals, caribbean nationals, and female candidates are strongly encouraged to apply.

what we do

civis analytics helps leading businesses, nonprofits, and government use data to identify, attract, and engage customers, constituents, and citizens. with a blend of proprietary data, technology and advisory services, and an interdisciplinary team of data scientists, developers, and survey science experts, civis helps organizations stop guessing and start using statistical proof to guide decisions. learn more about civis at www.civisanalytics.com ( http://www.civisanalytics.com ).

what we are looking for
-----------------------

civis is seeking a creative problem-solver who wants to use data to tackle some of the toughest challenges facing our communities. in this role, you will use your skills in data management, analysis, and visualization to help cities, states, and federal government use data to improve citizen services and outcomes. you will work on a cross-functional team of applied data scientists, software engineers, and data engineers to create products and tools that empower decision makers in all levels of government.

excellent analytical reasoning skills

us work authorization

at civis, we have opportunities for applicants who are newcomers, seasoned professionals, and anywhere in between. our teams are energized by complex challenges and value diversity of thought. opportunities to stand out and inspire happen daily and we trust and encourage you to act on your ideas – no matter how big they are. we offer you the tools and community you need to do your best work. each of us is committed to holding ourselves accountable for results, challenging the status quo and finding new ways to grow our company and each other.

summary
nhtsa is looking for an experienced traffic safety data analyst to complete projects that provides interdisciplinary support to ncsa's data reporting program in support of nhtsa's highway safety program.
the main data sources for analyses are the fatality analysis reporting system (fars) and national automotive sampling system (nass) general estimates system (ges)/crash report sampling system (crss).

responsibilities
as a traffic safety data analyst, you will :
produce reports and research notes that improve quantitative knowledge of the causes and results of motor vehicle traffic crashes using descriptive data techniques to support nhtsa's highway traffic safety program activities.
participate in developing the overall approach and methods for analyzing and reporting motor vehicle crash data from fars and ges/crss as related to behavioral and vehicle safety programs; specifying data sources, analytical techniques, and the schedule for reporting.
provide analytical support and guidance on motor vehicle crash data to other offices in the agency and regions.
provide data retrieval support in the division using data from fars and ges/crss. as an example statistical analysis system (sas) is one of the main retrieval tools used in the agency for all data retrieval, analyses, and query.

work with office of communication and consumer information (occi) in support of the media related activities like click it or ticket (ciot), impaired driving campaign and others.
contribute to the preparation of briefings, congressional inquiry responses, correspondence and short, quick turnaround assignments.

organizational overview
kipp dc is a network of high-performing, college-preparatory charter schools in washington d.c. which serve the city’s under-resourced communities. at kipp dc, there are no shortcuts: outstanding educators, more time in school, a rigorous college-preparatory curriculum, and a strong culture of achievement and support help our students make significant academic gains and continue to excel in high school and college.

position overview
data analysts are responsible for managing, analyzing, and reporting on school- and district-level student and academic data. data analysts are also responsible for implementing organizational data strategies around driving decision making and instructional practices through analyses and capacity building at the schools. data analysts work primarily on kipp dc’s school campuses, working closely with our school leaders, teachers, and other instructional staff. the data analysts report to the director of data.

this data analyst will work primarily with our kipp through college & career team, which supports kipp dc students with their transition to high school and college or career. read more about ktc at https://www.kippdc.org/kipp-through-college-careers/

key responsibilities
data analysts serve as a full-time and engaged member of kipp dc’s staff, including opportunities to assist with student recruitment and enrichment activities, supporting school-level operations and assessment administration as needed, and working with other staff members to ensure fulfillment of kipp dc’s mission.
a data analyst’s work falls into three interdependent categories:
data analysis, application, and action
conduct analytical work on outputs from kipp dc’s student information system, student assessments, teacher evaluations, data warehouse, and other organizational data platforms.
translate data into relevant insights and implications relevant to a given audience, anticipating and empathizing with stakeholder reactions.
regularly monitor key metrics and report significant changes or trends.
design, implement, and monitor the use of real-time data dashboards and platforms to support strategic decisions at the headquarters and school levels. seek feedback from teammates and end users to improve the product. provide training and coaching on tool use.
data management
maintain and manage student, teacher, and organizational data related to student assessments, academics, attendance, and behavior to inform instructional practices and organizational decisions.
develop an understanding of kipp dc’s data model and systems integration processes to enable tool building and data quality investigations.
assist with the coordination and administration of school level assessments such as anet benchmarks and nwea assessments.
develop and maintain documentation for data collection, management, and integration processes.
data strategy
build and maintain positive relationships with stakeholders in order to encourage questions and surface opportunities to provide support.
assist in building capacity among stakeholders to better use academic data, analytical tools, instructional technology, and rigorous analyses to improve instructional planning, monitor student and school progress, and drive student growth and achievement.
work with teammates to analyze current and future data needs of teams and departments. participate in planning a data strategy to meet needs.

required skills and characteristics
robust quantitative and analytical skills, including experience working with large datasets to derive insights.
outstanding project management and organizational skills, and extraordinary attention to detail.
experience working with multiple stakeholders, partners, and audiences.
results-oriented team player who is dedicated to getting the job done.
strong analytic, strategic, and problem-solving skills.
ability to work in a fast-paced environment under tight deadlines.
strong communication skills. conveys information in a way that is strategic, honest, timely, and respectful.
bachelor’s degree required, advanced degrees preferred.
unquestioned integrity and commitment to kipp dc’s mission.
flexibility, tenacity, high-quality work, resourcefulness, teamwork, and a sense of humor.
other preferred experience
advanced skills with ms excel.
experience as a teacher or in the education field is a plus
experience with data visualization and dashboarding tools (e.g. tableau, qlikview).
experience training and communicating data and analytics products to audiences of varying levels of expertise.
experience programming in data analysis languages and/or software (i.e. sql, r, stata, spss).
to apply

position overview
business information architecture (bia) is looking for an associate level candidate who is passionate about mortgage and related financial data, and applying standards and best practices to build and maintain repositories of metadata used to support the delivery of strategic initiatives. the successful candidate for this role will possess strong analytical skills and an interest in learning about business metadata and the artifacts and tools used to manage this information (e.g., a business glossary of terms, definitions; data dictionaries; etc.).

additionally, this candidate should have an interest in or experience with writing requirements to support data enhancements, to support new or updated application functions, based on changing business needs. this role will work with end users, other analysts and data modelers to build and maintain the terms and definitions for business information to be stored within the single-family business glossary, and to maintain the mapping of these terms and definitions to the business information model (bim), the logical data model for single-family.

this role will work with business stakeholders to ensure that the business contexts, sub-domains within the bim, are consistent with metadata management best practices and industry standards (e.g., iso, nist). this role will work with technology partners to ensure that the business glossary tool is correctly configured to support desired business functionality. lastly, the successful candidate for this role will also be part of our exciting journey to operationalize single-family’s big data strategy by ensuring its alignment to both the business glossary and the bim.

61.title: Data Scientist Trainee, Mid
61.posting:
the challenge:
are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by the iot, machine learning, and artificial intelligence advances? in an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open up new opportunities. as an aspiring data scientist, you know you can help turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. across private and public sectors — from fraud detection, to cancer research, to national intelligence — you see data scientists turning data into actions and you want to be part of the team.
we have an opportunity for you to develop your analytical skills and establish your career in data science. you’ll join a rigorous training program that combines skills assessments, a comprehensive curriculum, functional mentorship, a capstone analytic challenge, and support to place you on your first data science project. you’ll learn how to write scripts to integrate data, conduct exploratory data analysis to discover hidden trends, apply machine learning to train predictive models, and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn that set of disparate data points into objective answers that inform decisions. equipped with the foundational data science skills to accelerate your career, you’ll join a team and apply those skills to support our clients’ critical national security missions. embrace the challenge and join us in driving change through data science.
empower change with us.
build your career:
at booz allen, we know the power of analytics and we’re dedicated to helping you grow as a data analysis professional. when you join booz allen, you can expect:
access to online and onsite training in data analysis and presentation methodologies, and tools like hortonworks, docker, tableau, and splunk
a chance to change the world with the data science bowl—the world’s premier data science for social good competition
participation in partnerships with data science leaders, like our partnership with nvidia to deliver deep learning institute (dli) training to the federal government
you’ll have access to a wealth of training resources through our analytics university, an online learning portal specifically geared towards data science and analytics skills, where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and state-of-the-art tech from our in-house experts. pursuing certifications? take advantage of our tuition assistance, onsite boot camps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. we’ll help you develop the career you want, as you chart your own course for success.
you have:2 years of experience with analysis and data analytics and researching in a professional or intelligence work environmentexperience with querying or analyzing data to answer questions and solve problemsexperience with visualizing data to identify or communicate key insightsknowledge of basic concepts in mathematics and statisticsability to obtain a security clearanceba or bs degree
nice if you have:ability to pursue a career in data scienceability to work effectively in a collaborative team environmentability to learn a programming language
clearance:

we’re an eoe that empowers our people—no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic—to fearlessly drive change.

you have excellent written and verbal communication skills, are naturally curious and inquisitive, and are interested in continuously improving our work.
about usac
through its administration of the $10 billion universal service fund (usf) programs on behalf of the fcc, usac works to promote the availability of quality services at just, reasonable and affordable rates and to increase access to advanced telecommunications services throughout the nation. specifically, the usf programs provide funding for the expansion of telecommunications and broadband access to rural communities and health care facilities, schools and libraries across the country, and low income households. through program administration, auditing, and outreach, usac works with contributors, service providers, and program beneficiaries to achieve the program goals articulated by the fcc for each of these programs.
the fcc has reformed the usf to support further investment in and access to evolving broadband infrastructure, making the programs a primary vehicle to support this critical national priority. usac, as the administrator of the usf, plays a critical role in supporting the ambitious vision to ensure that all citizens in the united states have access to high-speed broadband. the organization has approximately 500 employees with an operating budget of more than $200 million. usac works in close partnership with the fcc and other federal and state partners to support the achievement of the usf program goals.
usac administers the usf programs—high cost, lifeline, rural health care, and schools and libraries. usac strives to provide efficient, responsible stewardship of the programs, a key national asset in making important telecommunications and internet services available to consumers, health care providers, schools, and libraries throughout the united states. the program divisions are supported by additional usac personnel in finance, general counsel, information systems, internal audit, the enterprise program management office and human resources. consistent with fcc rules, usac does not make policy for or interpret unclear provisions of statutes or the fcc’s rules.
universal service is paid for by contributions from telecommunications carriers, including wireline and wireless companies, and interconnected voice over internet protocol providers, including cable companies that provide voice service, based on an assessment of their interstate and international end- user revenues. these contributions are most typically passed through to consumers through a universal service fee line item on their telephone bills.
additional information on usf programs can be found at: http://www.usac.org/about/about/who-we- are/default.aspx

anser enhances national and homeland security by strengthening public institutions. we provide thought leadership for complex issues through independent analysis and we deliver practical, useful solutions. anser values collaboration, integrity, and initiative and we are client focused in all that we do. because we were established for the purpose of public service and not for profit, we measure our success in the impact of our service.

95.title: Privacy Data Misuse Analyst
95.posting:
facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at facebook are builders at heart. our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.

the mission of the privacy and data use team is to discover privacy vulnerabilities and data misuse on the facebook family of apps. the duties cover both internal infrastructure and externally facing products.

do you like identifying security and privacy issues in services, data, and products? join the facebook privacy & data use team! we are seeking passionate hackers (analysts and engineers) who derive purpose in life by revealing potential weaknesses and then working with cross-functional teams on creative solutions to eliminate those weaknesses. your skills will be the foundation of privacy initiatives that protect over a billion people. you will keep internal engineering and product teams in check to ensure facebook leads with world-class privacy practices. join to help us make the connected world more trusted.

responsibilities
analyze, assess, and respond to various privacy vulnerabilities we receive as part of our whitehat program.
follow up with researchers on unclear reports.
explore, understand and analyze the internal code base and flow of data to identified vulnerabilities.
work with cross-functional teams to report and improve privacy issues.
take a leadership role in driving internal privacy initiatives.
minimum qualifications
experience with internet privacy and security issues
communication experience with researchers, engineering and product teams
experience ensuring security and privacy on the internet
experience with big data and query languages
experience with big data and relational databases (hive, presto, mysql, etc.)
preferred qualifications
experience with a scripting programming language (php, python, perl, ruby, etc.)
experience with large-scale systems and data processing pipelines
ability to follow reports and reproduce them
contributions to the privacy community (participation in bug bounty programs, public research, blogging, presentations, etc.)
facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. if you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

97.title: Contract Data Analyst
97.posting:
what you’ll be doing...
this position will assist in developing and implementing tools to streamline and enhance the processes by which verizon contracts with and manages its relationships with its business and public sector customers. the position will use the seal tool and analytics tools provide critical contract data collection, analysis and reporting for the legal teams supporting verizon contracting with commercial, government and other customers. this information will enable verizon to negotiate contracts, manage risk, improve compliance, enhance standard contract language, expand automated transactions, and improve customers’ experience.
the successful candidate will:
use the seal platform and other techniques to extract key contract data.
implement seal’s analyze this now capability to provide real-time negotiation guidance.
develop processes/tools to track contracting performance indicators (e.g., cycle time).
document key processes, results, and best practices.
communicate results through regular reporting and data sharing.
support legal and other end users in their use of contracting data tools and output.
maximize the use of contract-data intelligence with customers, templates & compliance.
enhance other contracting processes, tools, content, and metrics as needed.
key skills:
focus on the business significance of each item of contract data.
probing analysis of relevant contract language to find actionable data.
persistence in refining results for completeness and accuracy.
what we’re looking for...
you’ll need to have:
bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
four or more years of relevant work experience.
even better if you have:
a degree.
managed and supported contracting processes for complex technical or service deliverables.
experience in sales, finance, legal, and/or contract negotiations.
juggled multiple projects under tight guidelines.
demonstrated influence and communication skills with internal and external stakeholders.
when you join verizon...
you’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. beyond powering america’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, internet of things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at verizon.
equal employment opportunity
we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences,including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and veteran status. different makes us better.

98.title: Program Analyst
98.posting:
duties
summary
this position is with the dod oig, evaluations component and is located in alexandria, va

responsibilities
serve as a member of a team of program analysts providing oversight across the full spectrum of programs, policies, procedures, and functions of dod overseas contingency operations in support of the lead inspector general for overseas contingency operations' mission.


in cooperation with incumbent's supervisor and team leader, serves as a technical advisor and specialist in all matters related to defense intelligence, counterintelligence, security and special access programs is support of the lead inspector general's mission.


assists evaluation team in the development and application of advanced analytical techniques and evaluative methodologies in planning and executing projects.


participates as appropriate and in cooperation with supervisor, team leader, and project team-in interagency projects of overarching issues influencing the lead inspector general for overseas contingency operations.


participates in projects that originate from the defense hotline, congressional affairs, and management requests. participates as a team member on other special projects as assigned. may conduct projects in conjunction with other military departments, defense agencies, and/or other government agency oversight organizations.


ensures, under supervision, that the projects are conducted in a manner that satisfies evaluation objectives. this includes ensuring that working papers provide a supportable basis for reporting.


follow procedures for safeguarding classified, contractor sensitive, or other sensitive government information and that ensure controls are in place to protect such material.


in cooperation with incumbent's project team under appropriate supervision, assists to draft and final reports for project and/or summary reports within assigned functional areas. the reports require analysis of complex programs, processes, and comprehensive knowledge of applicable dod policies and operations.


this position is being filled using 5 u.s. code subsection 3161 authority. this excepted service position is temporary and available for 13 months. this temporary position may be terminated early or extended beyond the 13 month period based upon incumbent performance and the needs of the oig.
